summary: i'm convinced jonerys stans don't know how to read. one of them was in the sansa tag bleating about how they'll only respect...
body: i’m convinced jonerys stans don’t know how to read. one of them was in the sansa tag bleating about how they’ll only respect sansa when she does what jon and dany accomplished in adwd. you know the book where dany barely held on to power and was chased out of meereen, the book in which jon was killed by his brothers after he declared war on the boltons despite his oaths? that book. if there’s anything i don’t want sansa to do it’s fail on that level

blog.name: pardonmymannerssir
blog.title: Pardon My Manners
blog.description: Fic writer by day, procrastinator by night.

summary: Everything I hold dear (resides in those eyes)
title: Everything I hold dear (resides in those eyes)
body:
Jon/Sansa one -shot. Read the entire thing on AO3 here.

Rating: Mature

Warnings: Some mentions of past rape.

Summary: Daenerys Targaryen will give up her throne for no man, not even one she loves, and so Jon Snow marries Sansa Stark and the world reshapes itself.

Sansa can tell by his breathing that he is still awake, they have not been abed long, and she bites her lip for a moment, summoning a bit of courage before reaching out and brushing a finger along one pinkish line that starts at the tip of a shoulder blade and dips down toward the other. He tenses beneath her touch but does not turn or move away.

“This one,” she murmurs, wetting her lips. “How did you get this one?”

His head angles toward her slightly, so that she catches the faint gleam of his eyes, like fire in deep, dark water.

“A wright, I think, though it’s hard to keep track,” there’s a hint of humor in his voice, but its faint and laden down with remembered pain and terror.

She drags her finger up to a puckered spot on his shoulder, wondering if she only imagines that he shivers beneath her touch. “And this one?”

He turns over fully then, startling her a bit as she retracts her hand, but he catches it in his, pressing it down into the bed between them. There is only a little space between them now, and her heart trembles slightly in her breast.

“An arrow,” he tells her, his eyes studying her in the dim light. There’s a story there, one that pains him, so she pushes no further.

His hair is unbound and the pretty curls fall across his forehead and eyes. She wonders absently what the strands might feel like, sliding between her fingers.  

“We’re hardly more than a patchwork of scars, aren’t we?” she asks, unable to hold his gaze for long, not this close, where her own wounds are laid bare. His fingers squeeze hers, rough with use, but warm and comforting all the same.

“We’re still here, and that’s all that really matters,” he tells her gruffly, firmly, and he’s right. They are here, here when so many others are not, and surely that is worth something.

 “Yes…” she replies after a long moment of comfortable, but strangely anticipatory silence. “Yes, I suppose  it is.”

They fall asleep like that, turned toward one another, hands clenched between them.

blog.name: thefeatherofhope
blog.title: Littlefeather
blog.description:
It's about what you believe. 
And I believe in love 💗

summary: “Just as if I was one of those true knights you love so well, yes. What do you think a knight is for, girl? You think it’s all...
body:
“Just as if I was one of those true knights you love so well, yes. What do you think a knight is for, girl? You think it’s all taking favors from ladies and looking fine in gold plate? Knights are for killing.” He laid the edge of his longsword against her neck, just under her ear. Sansa could feel the sharpness of the steel. “I killed my first man at twelve. I’ve lost count of how many I’ve killed since then. High lords with old names, fat rich men dressed in velvet, knights puffed up like bladders with their honors, yes, and women and children too—they’re all meat, and I’m the butcher. Let them have their lands and their gods and their gold. Let them have their sers.” Sandor Clegane spat at her feet to show what he thought of that. “So long as I have this,” he said, lifting the sword from her throat, “there’s no man on earth I need fear.”

A Clash of Kings, Sansa VI

Note to ASOIAF fandom followers: I've read all the books, and rarely if ever cut for spoilers, sorry. Please check my FAQ and the other links on my sidebar for more info.

summary: hello again wonderful cutie, I want to do some Dany/Sansa/Arya having a good time fanart, what are some activities I could draw...
question: hello again wonderful cutie, I want to do some Dany/Sansa/Arya having a good time fanart, what are some activities I could draw them doing? the only thing that comes to mind is having tea but I don't know much about how they would pass their time or company. Hope the wrist is better, have a nice day!
answer:
Here’s a good list of pastimes, some of which may be harder to draw than others I’m afraid. But tea is good – playing cyvasse is also good (Arya might be fascinated or frustrated by the strategy), or tiles (dominoes), or other table games like that. Hawking is fun (Catelyn promised Arya she could have her own hawk when she was older), though not sure if Dany might get interrupted by a dragon snatching her prey. ;)  Another option could be watching plays or performers, something non-offensive; or heck, Arya could perform while Sansa sings and plays, something like that.

And oh, if they’re in Winterfell, bathing in the hot pools could be a fun time – those are in the godswood, near the wall of the castle, I imagine when noble ladies are using them they probably encircle the area with sheets or something. But Sansa and Arya grew up swimming in the pools, and we all know Dany loves hot baths, so that could be perfect, yeah? Anyway, hope you find something you like!

summary:
Sansa Stark In Every Episode: ↳

blog.name: cleverjonquil
blog.title: As strong as my lady mother
blog.description: Side blog for all my Sansa/Catelyn/Elia love. Critical of show!Dany but still like book!Dany. Tully Loyalist. Pro Northern Independence. Book Jon >>> Show Jon. I track #courtesyismyarmor and #daughterofrivers

summary: They said Arya will be Queen in the North because she named her direwolf after a Queen's name. Meanwhile, Sansa named her...
question: They said Arya will be Queen in the North because she named her direwolf after a Queen's name. Meanwhile, Sansa named her direwolf as Lady. According to their logic, this is evidence that Arya will be Queen. Who cares about Sansa heavily Queen foreshadowing. Her direwolf name is Lady not Queen or after a Queen's name.
answer:
Yes, I’ve seen that too. lol who cares what Arya wants? Gurm after all is famous for giving his characters the OPPOSITE of their desires and not, like, giving them their wishes with a big twist or anything. Wouldn’t it be silly if he did?

It’s funny Arya looking up to Nymeria is “proof” that she’ll be a queen but not that Sansa looks up to Naerys. Or that Arya meets much of Varys’ personal idea of an ideal ruler except for history, being a good writer, poetry, all that stuff Sansa is good at (also, maybe actual experience like Sansa gets with Blackwater, performing pleasantries at Joff’s wedding, or her work as Lady of the Vale. I know fans like pretending women’s work is frivolous but Petyr would be nowhere without Sansa’s help running the Eyrie). Or that Sansa has strong parallels with Good Queen Alysanne while Arya isn’t as heavily connected to any at the moment. Or that Arya has no more interest in politics than she does experience- clearly everything Sansa is learning from Petyr will amount to absolutely nothing, ‘cause that’s just how good writing works /s.

Their arguments, like always, just aren’t solid and are based more on wish fulfilment than canon evidence. It’s hard to deny Arya has strong hints of a future leadership role, but do people not understand leader =/= queen? Is her playing a part in winning the Battle for the Dawn not good enough for them, or literally leading a pack of wolves? Do they want her to be queen to live vicariously through her and rise above mean old Sansa who totally had everything growing up which isn’t fair or because it thematically makes sense?

As for the names, personally I don’t think Lady’s means Sansa will never rule. I think in part it exemplifies her essence of a true lady, a genteel and loving heroine with hidden strength. Sansa doesn’t care about power, she cares about love and holding onto her ideals as the world tries to rip them from her. I think it also means that she will indeed be Lady of Winterfell.

tags: i should tag the ship in question but i wont im not THAT much of an asshole
summary: Sansa to Theon: “They were your brothers”
body:
Sansa to Theon: “They were your brothers”

She considers Theon to have been a brother to Bran and Rickon. She tells him as much. This matches up to what Theon is called in the North in ADwD: Theon Kinslayer. Kinslayer, even though he shares no blood with the Starks.

So explain to me, those of you who write the metas with thousands of words, how the North will be fine with Jon and Sansa marrying (and I’m gonna operate under the assumption it’s something they both want, which is absurd but nonetheless here we are, and not forced on them) when they consider Theon a brother to the Starks, EVEN THOUGH HES NOT. So how can they consider Jon anything but Sansa’s sister as well? How would the Northern Lords be fine with this shit?

They wouldn’t. They profoundly wouldn’t. They’d consider it incest. They’d want no part of it.

tags: ship: give your father a kiss
summary: “The hour was closer to dawn than to dusk, and most of the castle was asleep, but not Petyr Baelish. Alayne found him seated by...
caption: “The hour was closer to dawn than to dusk, and most of the castle was asleep, but not Petyr Baelish. Alayne found him seated by a crackling fire, drinking hot mulled wine with three men she did not know. They all rose when she entered, and Petyr smiled warmly. “Alayne. Come, give your father a kiss.”” - A Feast for Crows, George R.R. Martin

reblog.comment: “The hour was closer to dawn than to dusk, and most of the castle was asleep, but not Petyr Baelish. blog.name: turtle-paced
blog.title: turtle-paced
blog.description: Writing at the speed of the race course paradox.

summary: tatticstudio55 said:  @turtle-paced i just have a question.. Sansa was given the hairnet before her first talk with Olenna...
body:
tatticstudio55 said:  @turtle-paced i just have a question.. Sansa was given the hairnet before her first talk with Olenna right? So… Sansa’s admission that Joff was a monster didn’t really have anything to do with him being poisonned in the end, or..?

The Tyrells were checking up on what Littlefinger told them about Joffrey. Bit of independent background research on their part, making sure that they were heading off a real threat to Margaery’s safety rather than taking these risks assassinating a kid whose worst crime is being a teenager and a bit of a brat.
